required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AVATAR Anesthesia Alternative in Pediatric Radiotherapy: A Multi-Center Study
clinical_study.official_title: AVATAR Anesthesia Alternative in Pediatric Radiotherapy: A Multi-Center Study

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the success rate of the AVATAR audio-visual system. All patients enrolled in the study will be counted, and each patient who is able to undergo at least one fraction without anesthesia will count as a success while each patient who does not have at least one fraction without anesthesia will count as a failure. The success rate will be the proportion of patients who are successes.

primary_outcome.description: Success rate will be determined as the proportion of patients who are successes. Success will be counted as each patient who is able to undergo at least one fraction without anesthesia while each patient who does not have at least one fraction without anesthesia will count as a failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure Fractional Success using AVATAR system
secondary_outcome.description: Fractional Success will be is counted as a fraction in which the patient does not require anesthesia will count as a fractional success, while a fraction in which the patient required anesthesia will be a fractional failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the difference in patient anxiety between successful AVATAR patients and not-successful patients.
secondary_outcome.description: The difference in patient anxiety between successful AVATAR patients and not-successful patients will be determined. Anxiety will be assesed by modified Yale Preoperative Anxiety Survey Short Form (mYPAS-SF). mYPAS-SF measurement instrument uses 5 items, each representing a different domain of child anxiety, and is used at 4 points in time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the rates of anesthesia with historical controls
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the rates of anesthesia use between patients using AVATAR to historical controls who were not introduced to AVATAR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the rate at which patients convert from requiring anesthesia to not requiring anesthesia while using AVATAR
secondary_outcome.description: The rate at which patients convert from requiring anesthesia to not requiring anesthesia while using AVATAR will be determined. Conversion is determined by the fraction at which the patient switches from using anesthesia to not using anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in health quality of life between subjects with or without anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: The difference between family-reported health-related quality of life between patients who were able to tolerate treatment without anesthesia using the AVATAR program and patients who required anesthesia for the entire treatment. The quality of life will be measured using Pediatric oncology quality of life inventory 3.0-cancer module (PedsQL 3.0 Cancer Module)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess predictability for AVATAR patient success
secondary_outcome.description: AVATAR patient success will be determined by using the predictability of the PedsQL3.0 Cancer and modified Yale Preoperative Assessment Survey Short Form (mYPAS-SF) questionnaires. mYPAS-SF measurement instrument uses 5 items, each representing a different domain of child anxiety, and is used at 4 points in time.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Audio-Visual Assisted Therapeutic Ambience in Radiotherapy

intervention.arm_group_label: Audio-Visual Assisted Therapeutic Ambience in Radiotherapy

intervention.intervention_name: Yale Preoperative Anxiety Scale Short Form (mYPAS-SF)
intervention.description: Yale Preoperative Anxiety Scale Short Form (mYPAS-SF).[24] is a survey to measure anxiety
intervention.arm_group_label: Audio-Visual Assisted Therapeutic Ambience in Radiotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients ages 3-10 receiving radiotherapy qualify for enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that are not receiving radiotherapy, and/or are out of the eligible age range.
- If radiation treatment is discontinued before 50% of the treatment plan is completed
- If parent/guardian is unable to take part in helping to complete questionnaires
- Patients with malignancies of the eye for which radiation is planned

facility.name: Dana Farber Cancer Institute/Brigham & Women Children Hospital
Cincinnati Children's/UC Health Proton Therapy Center
